Entries.default: The entity's presence presses against the edge of your mind - of your soul - resolving into a soundless voice in the back of your head.
<ispeech>You see, but are also seen. As is your trespass.</ispeech>
"Ah, another involuntary invitation to another world. And I'm to assume this... eyeball is to blame?"
"Uh, you think it can see us?"
"This is new. I'd offer to take the first shot, but I'm not sure it'd do much good." Maia balls her fists at her sides.
"On your guard, Watcher."
"Don't suppose any of you be knowing what in the name of Wael's hidden fiddly bits that ball of blinkers be?"
"This terrible place would not be complete without an equally terrible overseer. I feel no empathy in this creature, captain." Tekēhu hugs himself and shivers.
"Certainly ain't the kind of eyes a gal wants to get lost in."
"The mind behind those eyes - this entity's intellect - it's staggering." Ydwin takes a very literal step back from the creature.
"Well I'll be godsdamned. Is this what's been smellin' like sausages?"
"Do not listen to this walking nightmare. It is an illusion baiting us to lunge at shadows."
"Agh, it is in my head! Get out, you!"
"Ah, a servant of the god of nothing real dragged us into the realm of nothing real."
<ispeech>What are you, interloper?</ispeech>
"I am [Player Name], the Watcher of Caed Nua."
"A Watcher. A ship captain. A killer of monsters and finder of treasures."
"What am I? What are you?"
"Unamused. Return me to the Here. Now."
"An aumaua. You can tell by the teeth. And the skin. And everything else."
"You've not seen a dwarf before?"
"You'd be surprised how often I get that."
"An orlan, clearly! Look at the fur! The ears! The not near as tall as you!"
<ispeech>You intrude upon the resting place of Wael, and soil these collections with your filthy fingers.</ispeech>
<ispeech>No.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Obviously. And a Watcher, as well.</ispeech>
<ispeech>We meant not your species, god-touched.</ispeech>
<ispeech>We see many things. Your people spread like insects across them all.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Obviously.</ispeech>
<ispeech>That is not the knowledge we seek.</ispeech>
"Hey, I thought there was something funny about you."
"Hey now, cap, don't go forgetting about the webbed fingers." Serafen wiggles his own furry digits.
<ispeech>We would know - are you one more wizard in pursuit of unearned power? Or something other?</ispeech>
"I am the Herald of Berath."
"You caught me! Now, uh, let me go?"
"Though I am many things, I am no wizard."
"Yes. I am very wizard. [Player Name] the Magical, at your service."
"Only what I said before. Monster killer. Captain. Treasure-finder."
"Did I stutter? Return me to the Here before I pop that ugly eye from its oversized socket."
"What's a wizard?"
"Watcher!" Aloth looks at you sidelong and grimaces, discreetly making a 'no' motion.
<ispeech>An obvious deception.</ispeech>
The entity's massive eye narrows as its eyestalks swivel upon you.
<ispeech>We do not find your demands compelling.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Thus far you have respected these halls. But your trespass remains unwelcome.</ispeech>
"Think it says 'we' so it don't have to be saying 'I?'" He taps a finger just below his right eye.
"It is not the time, Serafen."
Ydwin chuckles quietly, hiding her grin behind a closed hand.
"Do not encourage him, Ydwin."
"I serve the divine."
"Nobody notable."
<ispeech>Your modesty intrigues, but only in its obfuscation.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Death's touch finds no welcome in these halls.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Which divine?</ispeech>
"The Child of Light, Eothas."
"The lady of flames, Magran."
"The Quiet Slave."
"None of your business."
<ispeech>Yes. Their eyes peer from within your own.</ispeech>
<ispeech>You have proven yourself a murderer and a thief.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Thus far you have respected our purpose within these halls.</ispeech>
<ispeech>You must truly loathe Eora. And yourself equally.</ispeech>
<ispeech>No welcome awaits the touch of flame among our pages.</ispeech>
<ispeech>No welcome awaits your spite and whispers here.</ispeech>
<ispeech>You should leave this place, while you remain cognizant of the option.</ispeech>
"I only came here to prevent Maura from doing something dangerous."
"What exactly is this place? What's it's purpose?"
[Attack] "How about I stab you in the eye instead?"
<ispeech>No reason remains to fear her.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Farewell, interloper.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Such answers as you seek would damn you - and cost you more besides.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Yet you travel in the company of wizards.</ispeech>
"You are beautiful, captain. Let no one tell you otherwise." Tekēhu squeezes your shoulder.
"No? Postenago, we already got a tour of the mass grave in the basement."
<ispeech>Your destructive trespass within these halls cannot be forgiven. Farewell.</ispeech>
<ispeech>He who died and lives. He who would topple the pillars of the world.</ispeech>

<ispeech>How uncommon - a priest who does not proselytize.</ispeech>

The entity's eyes linger on you, quivering faintly.
Fassina crosses her arms and observes in quiet, unblinking disapproval.

<ispeech>Disappointing - yet predictable. Come then. Let us cleanse this place of your disruptive presence.</ispeech>

The entity's eyestalks quiver.
"Cognizant of the option? What's that supposed to mean?"
<ispeech>These halls will consume you. Body, soul, and history alike.</ispeech>

<ispeech>They will cleanse you.</ispeech>

The entity's tentacles shift beneath it, curling into small semicircles at their extremes.
Anger and pain roils off of the sagging entity, sweeping over you.

<ispeech>Unacceptable.</ispeech>

The entity quivers, one of its eyestalks glaring balefully at you.

<ispeech>You disrupt our precious library, spoil our artifacts, and yet expect release? We should -</ispeech>

The creature winces with every eye.

"Rymrgand's icy bollocks, keep it in your fucking pants, eyeball!" 

Serafen touches both hands to his temples, and the creature's agony - or your experience of it - seems blunted.

"Skyt!"

Ydwin closes her eyes and adjusts her glasses, and the creature's agony - or your experience of it - seems blunted.
"You are defeated. Impede us no further."
"If this thing starts crying, we're all in trouble."
<ispeech>Fine! Go! We release you!</ispeech>
<ispeech>Interfere no further!</ispeech>
"Return us to the Here."
"Be seeing you."
"You're hardly in a position to be making demands."
"I haven't begun my interference."
"You done?"
"And be quick about it, ac? Before we give you another black eye."

<ispeech>Go! Flee! Escape! Abscond! Issue forth!</ispeech>

Its eyes flutter as you feel a tingling sensation like static dancing across your skin.
"Feeling very clever today, I see."
The entity blinks at you.
"What is the alternative, staying here? I hate to say it, casità, but the eyeball creature might know best."
"It's freaks like you that go giving the gods a bad name."
Your stomach leaps within your belly as the darkness deepens.
"Tell it to Maura, you witless pawn." Fassina narrows her eyes. The Oracle mirrors her expression before shifting its focus back to you.
Rekke stifles a hiccup of nervous laughter.
<ispeech>We can no more allow you access to the body than we can the redacted archmage.</ispeech>
<ispeech>We cannot allow you to enter the body, nor to visit harm upon it.</ispeech>
"Access the body? The masked mage is trying to get into Wael?"
<ispeech>It will not be allowed. We've restricted access to the body.</ispeech>
